construction: Infinitive in binyan Hif'il from the root ס-כ-מ with the prefix לה-.

english: to set; to decide; to schedule; to determine
construction: Infinitive with prefix ל- from the root ק-ב-ע meaning to fix/decide.

english: seat; sitting; session; moshav (type of rural community)
construction: Noun with prefix מ- from root י-ש-ב 'to sit', indicating a place of sitting or settlement.

english: in front of; opposite; facing; versus
construction: Preposition historically related to root מ-ו-ל, expressing opposition or facing.
Past tense 1st person plural (נִהְיִינוּ) from root ה-י-ה 'to be', with נ- prefix and -נו suffix.
Adjective from root ב-י-ש 'shame', with the pattern קַטְלָן indicating a habitual trait.
Present tense masculine singular in Hif'il from root נ-ג-ע in the sense of 'to reach, to be due'.
Prepositional ל- 'to/for' + 1st person singular pronominal ending -י 'me'.
Comparative form from root י-ת-ר related to surplus/excess, used as 'more'.

english: I deserve more; more is due to me
construction: Phrase built from verb מגיע (Hif'il of נ-ג-ע) + pronoun לי 'to me' + comparative יותר 'more'.
Verbal noun from root ה-ל-ך 'to go', used as a noun meaning 'going'.
Verbal noun from root ח-ז-ר 'to return', meaning 'returning'.
Fixed phrase combining הלוך (going) and חזור (returning) to express a round trip.
Same as earlier: noun with prefix מ- from root י-ש-ב, a place where one sits or lives.
Same preposition as above, expressing 'opposite, facing'.
Same form as above: נִהְיִינוּ from root ה-י-ה with 1st person plural ending.
Same adjective as above: from root ב-י-ש with -ן ending for a character trait.
Same Hif'il present form of root נ-ג-ע meaning 'reaches / is due'.
Same pronominal preposition ל- + -י as above.
Same comparative form from root י-ת-ר used for 'more/greater'.

english: I deserve more; more is due to me
construction: Same phrase structure: מגיע (verb) + לי (indirect object) + יותר (comparative).

Same fixed phrase combining 'going' and 'returning'.

Past feminine singular in Hitpa'el from root ח-ל-פ, with הִתְ- prefix and -ה ending.
